column3: In this case the accused appellant was indicted under Sec.  365 (2)
(b)  (2) of the Penal Code.  The appellant was tried  in absentia and after a
lengthy trial he has been convicted for the said offence and convicted for

column2: 12 years RI and imposed a fine of Rs.  5,000/=. The appellant was ordered
to  pay Rs.  200,000/= as compensation for the victim.

column3: The story of the prosecution  is that on the day of the incident while
the victim was travelling in  a school van owned by the accused appellant

column2: she was sexually abused by the accused appellant.  She has complained
to  the  mother and  the  mother  has  taken  her to  the  police  station  from
where  she  has  been  produced  before  the  Judicial  Medical  Officer.
appears  from  the  evidence  that the  victim's  mother has  confronted  the
appellant before proceeding to the police station.

column3: The victim has been 4 years at the time of the incident and she has
given  evidence in  the High  Court when  she was  11  years of age.  Age of

column2: the  victim  has  not  been  disputed.  We  observe  that  she  has  been  a
competent witness according to the Evidence Ordinance. Evidence of the

column3: victim  has been corroborated by the mother's evidence and the evidence

column2: on  the  incident had  been  corroborated by the doctor's evidence.
